abstract: Op-Ed article by media ethicist Kelly McBride considers ethics of paying sources for information for news articles, in light of WikiLeaks initiative to crowd-fund large cash bounty for text of Trans-Pacific Partnership Deal; suggests WikiLeaks effort underscores need to adapt ethical conventions governing sources, particularly with respect to promoting transparency in age of unprecedented secrecy.
lead_paragraph: The WikiLeaks bounty for a TPP leak challenges us to rethink media ethics.

headline.main: When It’s O.K. to Pay for a Story
headline.print_headline: When It’s O.K. to Pay for a Story
